availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mortimore D. Pumphrey, Sr. (Breckinridge County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Breckinridge County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Anna Pumphrey. Father of Sarah G. Pumphrey, William G. Pumphrey, Richard A. Pumphrey, Charles H. Pumphrey, Alma C. Pumphrey, Mary E. Pumphrey, Mortimore D. Pumphrey, Jr., and Clarence Pumphrey. Tailor in Breckinridge County in 1850. Farmer in Breckinridge County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, District 1, p. 127. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, p. 31. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, District 2, p. 10. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, Haynes, p. 3. Find A Grave, "Rev. Mortimore Demillion Pumphrey, Sr. (1819-1902)," Memorial #34137688, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=34137688&ref=acom (accessed June 25, 2017).
